benchmark_details.name: LLM4AD (Large Language Models for Autonomous Driving)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper proposes a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the instruction-following abilities of LLM4AD in simulation, introduced along with the LaMPilot-Bench dataset.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the instruction-following capabilities and performance of LLM-based agents in autonomous driving tasks.

data.source: LaMPilot-Bench dataset consisting of 4.9K semi-human-annotated traffic scenes, with a subset of 500 samples for testing.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on predefined scenarios and their respective outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in safe driving and task completion.
methodology.baseline_results: Human driver performance established for comparative analysis.
methodology.validation: Internal testing through real-world vehicle experiments.
